section.title: GI communication flow
section.para: OTRS::GI has a defined flow to perform actions as a requester and as a provider.

listitem.para:
HTTP request
OTRS receives HTTP request and hands it through the layers

Network Transport
Choose right backend
Backend determines web service configuration (including the operation to perform)
Backend decodes data payload

Data external
Data as sent from the remote system

Mapping
Transforms the data as specified in the mapping configuration for this operation (incoming)

Data internal
Data as transformed and prepared to be passed to the operation (controller)

Operation
receives and validates data (with a generic helper function for all Controllers, which specifies the allowed values for each data field)
Performs authentication based on user data (see chapter 'Authentication/Access Control')
Performs user access control
Executes backend changes
Returns result data

Data internal
Data as returned from operation

Mapping
Transforms return data as specified in the mapping configuration (outgoing)

Data external
Data as transformed and prepared to be passed to Network Transport

Network Transport
Constructs a valid response for this network transport type and returns it to the client

HTTP response
In the case of an error, an error response is sent to the remote system (SOAP: SOAP error, REST: HTTP error)

Script or Event calls up GI
Desired remote web service and operation are passed along with the data payload to the Invoker

Invoker
Receives data, data validation (optional), custom actions before starting the request (optional)

Data internal
Data as passed from the caller

Mapping
Transforms the data as specified in the mapping configuration for this operation (outgoing)

Data external
Data as transformed and prepared for sending to the remote system

Network transport
Backend constructs a valid request for this network transport type, sends it and receives reponse
Backend decodes response data payload

Data external
Response data from web service

Mapping
Transforms the data as specified in the mapping configuration for this operation (incoming)

Data internal
Data as transformed and ready to be passed back to the caller

Invoker
Receives return data, custom actions after the request inc. error handling (optional)
Data is returned to the caller script / event handler
